did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Eastern Connecticut State University Events Collection1891-2010

langmaterial.language: The language of the materials is English

did.abstract: The University Events Collection includes information on various campus-wide events. The material in this collection ranges in years from 1891 through the present day.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: This collection was created by the Archives staff.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The University Events Collection includes information on various campus-wide events. The type of information varies. It may include programs, invitations, flyers, or general support paperwork as with the annual commencement. The material in this collection ranges in years from 1891 through the present day. Material is chronological with in each series. This collection is added to semi-annually.
This series offers information about special celebrations of school anniversaries including the 25th, 50th, 75th, 90th and 100th.

p.emph: Series II- Arts and Lectures Series

scopecontent.p: This series contains brochures from the University's Arts and Lectures Series which begun in the fall of 2001. Special guests include authors: John Updike, Maya Angelou, David McCullough; sports legend: Bill Russell; personality: Bill Nye, "the science guy" and musician, Pancho Sanchez.
This series contains programs from the baccalaureate ceremonies which take place on the day of graduation. These ceremonies have been held at the school from 1960-present.

This series contains information collected from commencement ceremonies dating back to1891, our 1st graduating class, to present day commencement celebrations. The series includes programs, tickets, jubilee reception information, faculty rosters, instructions for graduates and guests as well as information about speakers and special guests.
This series contains information related to campus-wide conferences and cultural events. Subjects range from International Affairs to Black History. The series covers from 1949 to present.

The Convocation Series is a collection of programs gathered from Convocation ceremonies from 1984 through the present. Some of the convocations are related to special occasions; however, most are general school convocations, which took place on the first day of the semester.

This series contains information about the dedication of new buildings on campus including Burr Hall, Shafer Hall and the 1st library building. Materials include guest books, programs and other significant print material related to these occasions.

The groundbreaking series contains programs and invitations to ceremonies celebrating the beginning construction of a new building. The series covers the groundbreaking ceremony for the first J. Eugene Smith library in 1968 and continues to the present.
This series contains invitations, programs, and paperwork from the inaugurations of Presidents beginning with President J. Eugene Smith in 1947 and continuing to the present.
This series currently contains a sample of programs and invitations for memorial services that have taken place at the school between 1981 and the present.
This series currently contains invitations and programs for the naming of buildings and special rooms from 1999 to the present.

The Receptions Series includes programs and invitations for various receptions held either on campus, or off campus in honor of faculty, staff, or students from 1988-present. Examples include faculty farewell receptions, emeritus faculty receptions, accounting & honor society receptions as well as the President's Recognition Luncheon.

This series contains invitations and programs, personal notes, invitations and programs for events which paid special honor to retiring administrators, faculty or staff members dating from 1945 to the present.

This series offers programs and informatio public gatherings, performances or presentations that took place in Shafer Auditorium or another major public space on campus. Events include Choral Festivals, Willimantic Orchestra, dramatic presentations, ECSU Author presentations, and the Connecticut Legislative Breakfast.

The Special Guests Series contains programs and information about individual authors, personalities or performers who presented at the school. This material dating from 1984 includes such notable guests as jazz musician Lionel Hampton and Connecticut Governor Lowell Weicker.

This series includes information documenting this campus-wide program which encourages the involvement and interaction of the Eastern community. The series which began in 1997 offers a broad range subjects. Past programming has included presentations by faculty, staff, administrators & students covering all disciplines; guest authors & speakers; performances in drama and music and discussions with state legislators and other political figures.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Mixed material labeled “College Events” was updated and organized to create the current University Events Collection which is divided into series by event type or title and arranged alphabetically and chronologically within series.
The files are grouped into 16 series:

list.item: Series II – Arts and Lectures Series

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Information related to other events at the University can be found in the Alumni Collection, Student Activities Collection, Athletic Department material, and various university publications in the Print Collection. The University Archives has a substantial collection of university archives material and also houses the Connecticut Studies Collection. For more detailed information on these collections please contact the staff member at the reference desk.

dsc.p: [The following section contains a detailed listing of the materials in the collection.]
